content.p:
"Early intervention services" shall mean services delivered to an
eligible child, pursuant to an individualized family service plan under
the early intervention program.

"Early intervention program" shall mean the early intervention
program for toddlers with disabilities and their families as created by
title two-A of article twenty-five of this chapter.
"Municipality" shall mean any county outside of the city of New\nYork or the city of New York.\n 2. Payments for early intervention services.
The commissioner\nshall, from funds allocated for such purpose under paragraph

of
subdivision six of section twenty-eight hundred seven-s of this article,
make payments to municipalities and the state for the delivery of early
intervention services.

Payments under this subdivision shall be made to municipalities
and the state by the commissioner. Each municipality and the state of
New York shall receive a share of such payments equal to its
proportionate share of the total approved statewide dollars not
reimbursable by the medical assistance program paid to providers of
early intervention services by the state and municipalities on account
of early intervention services in the last complete state fiscal year
for which such data is available.
